physdesc.extent: (1 record carton and 1 half document box)

did.abstract: Angela Brinskele has been the Director of Communications of the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives since 2006. Brinskele is also a freelance photographer who aims to preserve women's history through photography. She has been documenting the LGBT community since the mid 1980's and has documented many LGBT organizations and events including the LA Gay and Lesbian Center, Women On a Roll, Dinah Shore Weekend, Prides all over Southern California, as well as covering political activism including the 1991 March on the Capitol in Sacramento over AB101. This collection contains photographs covering gay and lesbian cultural and pride events from 1986 through 2008, with a focus on lesbians in Southern California.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Angela Brinskele Photographs (Collection 2158). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Jessica Tai in 2017.

The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Angela Brinskele has been the Director of Communications of the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives since 2006. She is the first paid staff person since they were founded in 1981. Brinskele studied photography at Cal State Fullerton and works as a freelance photographer who aims to preserve women's history through photography. She has been documenting the LGBT community since the mid 1980's with a special emphasis on Lesbians in Southern California. Brinskele has worked as a photographer for The Lesbian News for several years, as well as for Outfest since the late 1990s. Angela has documented many LGBT organizations and events including the LA Gay and Lesbian Center, Women On a Roll, Dinah Shore Weekend, Prides all over Southern California, as well as covering political activism including the 1991 March on the Capitol in Sacramento over AB101.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs covering gay and lesbian cultural and pride events from 1986 through 2008, with a focus on lesbians in Southern California.

controlaccess.subject: Gay pride celebrations -- United States -- Photographs.
Outfest (Film Festival).
controlaccess.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library
June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These leather bound albums contains photos taken at gay and lesbian cultural events in California, predominately in Los Angeles. The majority of the photos cover city pride events, Outfest Gay and Lesbian Film Festival, GLAAD and Trevor Project events in addition to other media outlets and organizations. Albums contain commentary, often identifying the event and subjects of the photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs from events including Butch Voices L.A., The L World premiere, the Christopher Street West and Human Rights Campaign Gala, Brenda Weather's Life Celebration, and the Barbara Gittings event at UCLA. Also contains a matted photograph of Kim Turner and Kathleen McHugh from the 1985 West Coast Music and Comedy Festival.
